page.title: 20Smarden West - Looking Back
page.content: Smarden has changed a lot since I was a boy 50 years ago. In those days we were a self-sufficient community, having our own dairy, bakery, 3 grocers, 3 butchers, 2 cobblers, 2 blacksmiths, a garage, an ironmonger & many other tradesmen, a fire station, doctor and policeman. Now we have only 1 grocer, 1 butcher, the post office and a garage. Several buses a day ran into Ashford; when most families could only afford bikes going to Ashford on the bus or being taken in by a farmer going to market was a real treat. Buses ran late at night to bring home cinema-goers, now those without cars are handicapped. Most families had lived here for generations, now there are many strange faces. It is sad not to know people as we used to when everyone was proud to be a Smardonian born and bred.
